title-group.article-title: Response to “Fine-Tuning Our Personalized Medicine for Otitis Media” by David S. Hurst

body.p: I am greatly appreciative of Dr Hurst’s letter concerning my recent article “Otitis Media: The Application of Personalized Medicine.”1 He is entirely correct in noting that allergy is an intrinsic risk factor and that common allergens are extrinsic risk factors. The purpose of my article was not to detail every risk factor but to define the general categories. One would certainly consider allergy within the group of immune deficiencies and allergens as one of the extrinsic factors of air pollution. It is hoped that the ideas promulgated in my article will result in carrying out the prospect of studies so that quantitative values can be assigned to the specific entity subsumed under the general classifications that I have given in my prototype table. I have formulated a strategy, and next we need to define the clinical meaningful specifics; certainly, allergy will play an important role as both an intrinsic and extrinsic determinant.

ref.citation: RubenRJ . Otitis media: the application of personalized medicine. Otolaryngol Head Neck Surg. 2011;145(5):707–712.
